clinical_study.brief_title: Size Progression of Macular Degeneration After Cataract Surgery
clinical_study.official_title: Size Progression of Non-Exudative Age-Related Macular Degeneration After Cataract Surgery

lead_sponsor.agency: The Ludwig Boltzmann Institute of Retinology and Biomicroscopic Laser Surgery

collaborator.agency: Medical Scientific Fund of the Mayor of Vienna

clinical_study.source: The Ludwig Boltzmann Institute of Retinology and Biomicroscopic Laser Surgery

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study was to find out if in patients with non-exudative age-related macular degeneration (AMD), randomly assigned to cataract surgery, any AMD size progression or progression to exudative AMD could be detected 6 months after surgery.

primary_outcome.measure: AMD size (defined central region of interest)
primary_outcome.description: To evaluate AMD size progression, absolute and relative differences in pixels of the ROI were cal-culated by equivalent tests.

secondary_outcome.description: Cataract grade (LOCS-III), Visual acuity (distance/near), contrast acuity tests, Visual Function Index (VF-14)

arm_group.description: Fifty-four patients with cataract and non-exudative age-related macular degeneration (AMD) were randomized into an early surgery group (ES=28) with immediate cataract surgery and a control group (CO=26) where surgery was performed after six months.

intervention.description: Fifty-four patients with cataract and non-exudative age-related macular degeneration (AMD) were randomized into an early surgery group (ES=28) with immediate cataract surgery and a control group (CO=26) where surgery was performed after six months.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients with cataract and non-exudative age-related macular degeneration
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patients with retinal pathologies other than AMD, exudative AMD, progressive glaucoma, myopia > 10 diopters, panretinal laser treatment, former cataract or vitreoretinal surgery, were excluded.

facility.name: The Rudolph Foundation Hospital, Dept. of Ophthalmology

clinical_study.keyword: Influence of cataract surgery on AMD Size
